title: Display credits alongside dollar cost on generation page
description:
## Cost Display on Generation Page

Display both credits AND dollar cost when users estimate generation cost.

### Format
Show: **"12,450 credits ($2.49)"**

### UX Research Finding
Best practice from UX research: Show BOTH formats together
- Credits: Primary currency users understand (what they bought)
- Dollars: Reference point for real-world value

### Implementation
1. Call `GET /api/v1/generations/estimate` 
2. Response includes `creditsRequired` (after API fix) and `estimatedCost`
3. Display in format: `{credits} credits (${cost})`

### Location
- Generation page cost estimate section
- Before "Generate" button

### Backend Dependency
- Requires `voiceprocessor-api-p71` (Add CreditsRequired to CostEstimateResponse)

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Cost estimate shows credits and dollars
- [ ] Format: "X,XXX credits ($Y.YY)"
- [ ] Updates dynamically as text changes
- [ ] Per-provider breakdown also shows credits

title: Add output format selection (M4B chapters vs MP3 per chapter)
description:
## Output Format Selection

Allow users to choose between audiobook format (M4B with chapters) or individual MP3 files per chapter.

### Options (from planning session)
| Format | Description | Use Case |
|--------|-------------|----------|
| M4B with Chapters | Single file, chapter markers embedded | Audiobook players, Apple Books |
| MP3 per Chapter | Separate file for each chapter | Flexibility, sharing individual chapters |

### Decision: Offer BOTH
User selects their preferred format before generation.

### UI Design
1. Radio button or toggle group
2. Label: "Output Format"
3. Options:
   - "Single Audiobook (M4B)" - default
   - "Separate Files (MP3 per chapter)"
4. Brief explanation of each format

### Backend Dependency
- Requires `voiceprocessor-api-2yp` (Chapter detection)
- Requires `voiceprocessor-api-cyy` (Chapter markers in audio)
- API must support output format parameter

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Format selection UI on generation page
- [ ] Two options: M4B single file, MP3 per chapter
- [ ] Default to M4B
- [ ] Selection sent to API
- [ ] Help text explains difference

title: Auto-refresh credits after successful payment
description:
## Frontend: Auto-refresh Credits After Payment

Ensure user credits are updated immediately after successful Stripe payment.

### Problem
After Stripe checkout, user redirects to success page but may see stale credit balance until page refresh.

### Solution
1. On success page mount, fetch updated user profile
2. Update global credits state
3. Show toast notification confirming credits added

### Implementation
1. Call GET /api/v1/auth/me or user endpoint to get fresh credits
2. Update user context/store with new creditsRemaining
3. Display toast: Added 10,000 credits to your account
4. Dashboard should reflect new balance without refresh

### Technical Notes
- Webhook processing adds credits before user redirects
- Success page should always show updated credits
- Consider using React Query invalidation or similar

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Credits refresh on success page
- [ ] Dashboard shows updated balance
- [ ] Toast notification confirms purchase
- [ ] No manual refresh needed

title: Implement text input character limits with warnings
description:
## Text Input Character Limits

Implement character limits for manual text input on generation page.

### Limits (from planning session)
| Threshold | Action |
|-----------|--------|
| 50,000 chars | **Soft warning**: "This is a long text. Consider uploading a file instead." |
| 100,000 chars | **Cost warning**: "This will cost approximately X credits" |
| 500,000 chars | **Hard max**: Prevent input, show error |

### Why These Numbers
- 50k = ~12,500 words = short novel/long article
- 500k = ~125,000 words = full novel (hard limit)
- Aligns with planned document upload feature (Beta)

### Implementation
1. Add character counter below text input
2. Show counter as: "12,345 / 500,000 characters"
3. Change color at thresholds (yellow at 50k, orange at 100k, red near 500k)
4. Show contextual warnings at thresholds
5. Disable Generate button at 500k+

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Character counter displayed
- [ ] Soft warning at 50k (non-blocking)
- [ ] Cost warning at 100k
- [ ] Hard block at 500k
- [ ] Clear error message at limit
- [ ] Counter color changes at thresholds

title: Integrate Stripe checkout for credit pack purchases
description:
## Frontend: Stripe Checkout & Credit Packs Billing Page

Refactor billing page to support credit packs model and integrate with Stripe checkout.

### Backend Endpoints (Ready & Tested)
- GET /api/v1/payments/packs - Returns available credit packs with prices
- POST /api/v1/payments/checkout - Creates Stripe checkout session, returns checkoutUrl
- GET /api/v1/payments/history - Returns payment history

### Billing Page Requirements
1. Display current credit balance prominently
2. Show available credit pack cards with name, credits, and price
3. Buy button for each pack triggers Stripe checkout
4. Payment history section (can link to voiceprocessor-web-e07)

### Implementation Steps
1. Fetch credit packs from API on billing page load
2. Display packs as cards (e.g., Short Story $0.99, Novella $9.99, Audiobook $49.99)
3. On Buy click, call checkout endpoint with priceId
4. Redirect user to returned checkoutUrl from Stripe

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Credit balance displayed on billing page
- [ ] Credit pack cards shown with prices
- [ ] Buy button triggers checkout flow
- [ ] User redirected to Stripe checkout
- [ ] Loading states during API calls
- [ ] Error handling for failed requests

Consolidates: voiceprocessor-web-o7x

### Acceptance Criteria

title: Implement payment success/cancel callback pages
description:
## Frontend: Payment Success/Cancel Callback Pages

Create pages to handle Stripe checkout callbacks after payment completes or is cancelled.

### URLs to Implement
- /payment/success - Shown after successful payment
- /payment/cancel - Shown if user cancels checkout

### Success Page Requirements
1. Display Payment Successful confirmation
2. Show purchased pack details (name, credits added)
3. Refresh user credits from API
4. Go to Dashboard button
5. Optional: Confetti animation

### Cancel Page Requirements
1. Display Payment Cancelled message
2. Try Again button - returns to billing
3. Contact Support link

### Technical Notes
- Success URL receives session_id query param from Stripe
- Can optionally verify session status via backend
- Credits already added by webhook before redirect

### Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] /payment/success route created
- [ ] /payment/cancel route created
- [ ] Success page refreshes credits
- [ ] Cancel page offers retry option
- [ ] Both pages are responsive
